title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
U.S. inflation continued to accelerate in June at the fastest pace in 13 years as the recovery from the pandemic gained steam and consumer demand drove up prices for autos, airline fares and other items.

---

Goldman and JPMorgan reported big second-quarter profit gains, fueled by fees from advising companies on mergers and underwriting IPOs and other stock sales.

---

U.S. stocks declined from records set the previous session, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq losing 0.35%, 0.3%. and 0.4%, respectively.

---

Talks for Broadcom to buy SAS Institute have ended after the founders of the closely held software firm changed their minds about a sale.

---

Norwegian Cruise Line sued Florida's surgeon general, challenging the state's barring of businesses from requiring proof of Covid-19 vaccination.

---

China's top market watchdog approved Tencent's plan to privatize search-engine affiliate Sogou in a deal valued at around $2 billion.

---

Google was fined $593 million by France's Competition Authority for allegedly violating orders to negotiate paid deals with news publishers.

---

Musk, wrapping up two days of testimony, told a court that Tesla bought SolarCity to become more than a car company.

---

Vanguard is buying JustInvest, a smaller investing upstart that helps financial advisers build personalized portfolios.
